sections.title: Basis
sections.description: Define the foundation of the website.

items.title: Layout types
items.description: This describes how many unique layout types the website will have. One layout type describes a section of the website, which fulfills one unique task or represents a single type of information. For example, a website can have a landing page, a contact area or a section, which represents your team with a little photo of each person.

items.title: Features
items.description: What should your new website offer to the visitors?

sections.title: Compatibility
sections.description: Define the compatibility of the website.

items.title: Secure Communication (HTTPS)
items.description: Should the connection between the visitor and your website be encrypted? This also helps to optimize your search engine rank.

items.title: Responsiveness
items.description: Today visitors use  many different devices, with different screen sizes. Should the website automatically adapt to the users screen size?

items.title: Browser support
items.description: Unfortunately not all browser understand the code of a website in the same way. Additionally there are many versions and different kind of browsers in use. Select the browser which should be supported by your new website.

options.label: Latest versions of common browsers (Microsoft Edge, Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Apple Safari)
Modern versions of common browsers (Microsoft Internet Explorer >= 11, Microsoft Edge >= 15, Google Chrome >= 60, Mozilla Firefox >= 55, Apple Safari >= 10)

sections.title: Infrastructure
sections.description: To bring a website online, infrastructure like servers or a domain name is needed.

items.title: Hosting
items.description: This server contains your website and delivers it to your visitors.

items.title: Email accounts
items.description: How many email accounts or redirects do you need?

sections.title: Other
sections.description: More tasks and options to create your website.

items.title: Order fee
items.description: To pay the infrastructure and get the project up and running some time needs to be invested. This fee covers this expenses.

items.title: Maintenance fee
items.description: It's important that the infrastructure is up to date and available. This fee covers the time to make sure everything is working properly.
